results.title: Her Story
results.brief_description: Independently developed by Sam Barlow, Her Story uses live-action footage to follow a police interrogation and is influenced by the directing techniques of Alfred Hitchcock and the Dogme 95 school of filmmaking, as well as real-life interrogations and Sharon Stone’s performance in Basic Instinct (1992).

constellations_primary.name: Screen story searching
constellations_primary.description: Cinema, smartphones and sensuality collide in this intriguing Constellation that takes a distinctly different path.

results.description:
Hannah’s husband is missing and the police have questions.

Her Story follows Hannah’s interrogation and is an interactive full-motion video (FMV) narrative made up of seven police interviews, split into smaller clips viewed on a 1990s-style desktop. Players watch, interpret and dissect these interviews to discover the truth in the characters’ stories.

Independently developed by Sam Barlow, Her Story uses live-action footage instead of rendered character models and is influenced by the directing techniques of Alfred Hitchcock and the Dogme 95 school of filmmaking, as well as real-life interrogations and Sharon Stone’s performance in Basic Instinct (1992).
description_for_label:

Her Story follows Hannah’s interrogation and is an interactive full-motion video (FMV) narrative made up of seven police interviews, split into smaller clips viewed on a 1990s-style desktop. Players watch, interpret and dissect these interviews to discover the truth in the characters’ stories.

Independently developed by Sam Barlow, Her Story uses live-action footage instead of rendered character models and is influenced by the directing techniques of Alfred Hitchcock and the Dogme 95 school of filmmaking, as well as real-life interrogations and Sharon Stone’s performance in Basic Instinct (1992).

results.title: Hephzibah
results.brief_description: A documentary about Hephzibah Menuhin, sister of acclaimed violinist Yehudi, who led her own remarkable life. In 1938 when she was eighteen she abandoned a promising career as a concert pianist in the United States to marry Lindsay Nicholas, Australian heir to the Aspro fortune, moving to his remote sheep station. Following the War, Hephzibah toured Europe and had a scandalous affair with Viennese sociologist Richard Hauser. Moved by the horrors of the concentration camps, she became increasingly isolated from her privileged life in Australia. She left her husband and children, married Hauser and settled in London where the couple established their Centre for Human Rights. The documentary utilises archival home movie footage, Hephzibah’s letters and music from her performances to gain insight into the decisions she made throughout her life.

results.title: Henry VIII and his six wives
results.creator_credit: Waris Hussein, Roy Baird and Anglo-EMI Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the BBC television miniseries “The Six wives of Henry VIII” this feature film version combines what was a very successful television series into an equally entertaining and well-received film. It has a quality of richness and power and yet at the same time offers a human, almost vulnerable, side to Henry as he desperately searches for a wife who can produce a son and heir to the throne of England. His life is continually surrounded by plots and conspiracies from those who have ulterior motives as to who Henry should marry. Donald Pleasence puts in an excellent performance as Thomas Cromwell and Keith Michell is truly magnificent as Henry VIII as he physically changes from a proud young man to a quite obese and gout-ridden lonely old man. The six wives are played equally as well by Frances Cuka (Catharine of Aragon), Charlotte Rampling (Anne Boleyn), Jane Asher (Jane Seymour), Jenny Bos (Anne of Cleves), Lynne Frederick (Catharine Howard) and Barbara Leigh-Hunt (Catharine Parr).

results.title: Henry V: the Battle of Agincourt [study extract]
results.brief_description: Vividly presents the Battle of Agincourt, from Henry V by Shakespeare. The study extract shows the preparations for, and the actual fighting by, both infantry and cavalry with all its noise, colour and confusion.

results.title: Henry V [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Branagh, Bruce Sharman, BBC and Renaissance Films
results.brief_description: Henry V, young king of medieval England, roused his troops to arms against a French army five times greater than themselves. His life and leadership was legendary. From the above story, William Shakespeare wrote one of his greatest plays. Kenneth Branagh, whose stage portrayal of Henry V has been world-acclaimed, made his film directorial debut with this film. Also starring Paul Scofield, Derek Jacobi, Judi Dench and Christian Bale, the film loses none of the power and beauty of Shakespeare’s text.

results.title: Henry V
results.creator_credit: David Giles, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description: Shortly after his coronation, Henry V decided to press his claims to the French throne and leads an army into France. He defeats a vastly larger French army at Agincourt (1415), wins the hand of the French Princess Catherine of Valois, and is recognised as the heir to the French throne.

results.title: Henry Morton Stanley
results.creator_credit: Fred Burnley, Michael Latham and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Explorers”.
This film re-enacts the journey Stanley undertook to complete Livingstone’s exploration by searching for the headwaters of the Lualaba River in central Africa. Narrated by David Attenborough. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
